body: I can pick this up. If no one is picking

> I can pick this up. If no one is picking

If you decide to start working on it, please just say so here so that we can mark it as "in progress".

@sbrannen 
I will work on this.


I need more information on this though.
1. Could you please redirect me to exact class (with the full package ).
2. Is this for all the methods in the class or all?
3. How to test the behavior?


Regards,
Gopinath

The easiest way to find where something like this is used is to search for uses within the code base.

For example, I just searched for where `org.junit.platform.launcher.TestExecutionListener.executionFinished(TestIdentifier, TestExecutionResult)` is invoked, and the results show me:

- `org.junit.platform.launcher.core.ExecutionListenerAdapter`
- `org.junit.platform.launcher.core.TestExecutionListenerRegistry`

So you'll need to analyze invocations of all methods in `TestExecutionListener` and determine the best place to add try-catch blocks.

>     2. Is this for all the methods in the class or all?

It's for the entire API, so all methods in the `TestExecutionListener` interface.

Regarding where to test it, you'll need to find an appropriate place within the `platform-tests` module.

And you'll need to create an "exception throwing" `TestExecutionListener` (stub or mock), register it, execute a simple test plan, and verify that the exceptions were all swallowed and logged. See uses of `org.junit.jupiter.engine.TrackLogRecords` for achieving the latter.

Hello @sbrannen ,
Thanks for the information. I will start working on this.

issue.title: Safeguard against exceptions thrown in TestExecutionListeners

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Issue: #1777


## Overview

Prior to this PR, Test plan used to fail upon exception occurs while executing `TestExecutionListener` or `EagerTestExecutionListener`. 
To improve the platform behavior, we decided to not fail the test plan vs log an exception occurred in `TestExecutionListener` or `EagerTestExecutionListener` (WARN level) and continue test plan.


---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
